service

Class MapService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.MapService

  • public class MapService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to handle all the service calls from MapController class. This is used to implement required business logic.
    Author:
    Yogesh

    • Method Detail

      • validateMap

        public void validateMap(java.util.Set<Continent> continentsSet,
                        java.util.Set<Territory> territoriesSet,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> errorList)
        This method is used to validate that whether the map in application memory is valid map or not.
        Parameters:
        continentsSet: - Set which represent continent object.
        territoriesSet: - Set which represent territories object.
        errorList: - An ArrayList to store validation errors.

      • checkConnectedGraph

        private void checkConnectedGraph(Territory territoryObject,
                                 java.util.Set<Territory> queueForChecking,
                                 Continent continentOfTerritory)
        This is a DFS function to check that whether the graph is connected or not.
        Parameters:
        territoryObject: - A starting object of Territory, could be any Territory.
        queueForChecking: - A set to keep the Territories
        continentOfTerritory: - A continent object referring to a continent whose territories we are traversing. It will be null for the case when we will check that if the whole graph is connected or not.

      • saveMap

        public boolean saveMap(java.io.File file,
                       java.util.HashSet<Continent> continentsSet,
                       java.util.HashSet<Territory> territoriesSet)
        This method is used to save the created/modified map as a file.
        Parameters:
        file: - File object to which file needs to be written and save.
        continentsSet: - Set of all the continents in map.
        territoriesSet: - Set of all the territories in map.
        Returns:
        boolean: true if file is save else false.

      • parseFile

        public void parseFile(java.io.File file,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> errorList)
        This method is using the File object in order to access the file and parse it's contents. It will call the rendering Class method which will render the map on UI.
        Parameters:
        file: - This object is passed from the class where we choose a particular map file.
        modifyOrPlay: - true if this method is called for modifying the exisiting map else false if called to play.
        Throws:
        Exception: - Throw file not found and other custom exceptions.
